thread.title: Emirates airline flying all big birds to London
thread.title_full: Emirates airline flying all big birds to London

author: eTN Editor
title: Emirates airline flying all big birds to London
text:
Emirates airline flying all big birds to London Adv: 
By Prof. Wolfgan H. Thome, Ph.D., eTN Africa Correspondent | Aug 07, 2015 Adv: 
As Emirates, Dubai’s award-winning national airline, takes delivery of yet more Airbus A380 aircraft – already being the largest operator in the world for this aircraft type – so will more destinations be able to see this giant bird come their way. 
Only yesterday, the airline confirmed their intent to up the last of their 8 daily London flights from the B777 to the A380 come January 2016, the flight in question being one of 3 daily services to London Gatwick. 
Emirates presently operates 5 daily services on the A380 to London Heathrow and 2 of their 3 Gatwick services, too, offering a massive seat capacity for passengers from in particular Africa, the Gulf, and Asia to the UK’s capital city. 
With British Airways’ pulling out of Uganda in October, Emirates, along with the other Gulf airlines, will provide options to reach London though the European legacy carriers flying out of Entebbe and will no doubt put up a fight to capitalize on shorter flying times and a wider range of connections from their hubs in Brussels and Amsterdam to London and other UK cities.
